capability_id.description: Configure provider with the context of the capability's id

dns_name.description: The name of the autogenerated subdomain.

domain_name.description: The domain name that nullstone manages for this autogenerated subdomain. It is usually `nullstone.app`.

env_id.description: The autogen subdomain belongs to this env.

fqdn.description: The fully-qualified domain name (FQDN) that nullstone manages for this autogenerated subdomain. It is composed as `{dns_name}.{domain_name}.`.

id.description: This attribute is only present for some compatibility issues and should not be used. It will be removed in a future version.

subdomain_id.description: The autogen subdomain belongs to this subdomain.

env_id.description: The autogen subdomain belongs to this env.

id.description: This attribute is only present for some compatibility issues and should not be used. It will be removed in a future version.

nameservers.description: A list of nameservers that refer to a DNS zone where this subdomain can delegate.

subdomain_id.description: The autogen subdomain belongs to this subdomain.

app_id.description: The ID of the application in nullstone.

env_id.description: The ID of the environment in nullstone.

id.description: This attribute is only present for some compatibility issues and should not be used. It will be removed in a future version.

stack_id.description: The ID of the owning stack for the application in nullstone.

version.description: The version configured for the application in the specific environment.

block.description: Data source to configure module based on current nullstone workspace.

id.description: This attribute is only present for some compatibility issues and should not be used. It will be removed in a future version.

name.description: The unique name of the connection within this module.

optional.description: This data source will cause an error if optional is false and this connection is not configured.

outputs.description: An object containing every root-level output in the remote state.

type.description: The type of module to satisfy this connection.

via.description:
Defines this connection is satisfied through another ns_connection.
Typically, this is set to data.ns_connection.other.name

workspace_id.description: This refers to the workspace in nullstone. This follows the form `{stack}/{env}/{block}`.

block.description: Data source to configure a connection to another nullstone workspace.

block_id.description: The block ID of the subdomain (in the specified stack)

dns_name.description: The DNS name defined on the domain

id.description: This attribute is only present for some compatibility issues and should not be used. It will be removed in a future version.

stack_id.description: The stack ID that owns this subdomain

block.description: Data source to read a nullstone domain.

block_id.description: The block ID of the subdomain (in the specified stack)

dns_name.description: The DNS name defined on the subdomain

id.description: This attribute is only present for some compatibility issues and should not be used. It will be removed in a future version.

stack_id.description: The stack ID that owns this subdomain

block.description: Data source to read a nullstone subdomain.
The name of the stack in nullstone that owns this workspace.

block_id.description: The ID of the block in nullstone associated with this workspace.

block_name.description: The name of the block in nullstone that owns this workspace.

block_ref.description:
The reference of the block in nullstone that owns this workspace.
This is typically used to construct unique resource names. See unique_name.

env.description: The name of the stack in nullstone that owns this workspace.

env_id.description: The ID of the environment in nullstone associated with this workspace.

env_name.description: The name of the block in nullstone that owns this workspace.

hyphenated_name.description: A standard, unique, computed name for the workspace using '-' as a delimiter that is typically used for resource names.

id.description: This attribute is only present for some compatibility issues and should not be used. It will be removed in a future version.

slashed_name.description: A standard, unique, computed name for the workspace using '/' as a delimiter that is typically used for resource names.

stack.description: The name of the stack in nullstone that owns this workspace.

stack_id.description: The ID of the stack in nullstone that owns this workspace.

stack_name.description: The name of the stack in nullstone that owns this workspace.

tags.description: A default list of tags including all nullstone configuration for this workspace.

workspace_id.description: The fully qualified workspace ID. This follows the form `<stack>/<env>/<block>`.

block.description: Data source to configure module based on current nullstone workspace.
